job_summary:
Are you interested in joining the Security Engineering team that is responsible for improving the security posture of the LEGO Group? We are on a journey to help our product teams by providing high quality security data and guidance.
  Core Responsibilities


Reduce vulnerabilities and improve security control effectiveness
Learn and grow – we will help
Contribute to delivery of security initiatives

 Play your part in our team succeeding
 The LEGO Group is looking for an Associate Security Engineer to join our Posture Management team.
 
 Security Posture Management exists to help the LEGO Group stay cyber resilient. You’ll spend your time helping product teams to reduce defects and improve control effectiveness by providing easy access to expertise, embedded security, and superior vulnerability management processes.
 
 This is a permanent full-time position based in Denmark. Our office is located in Billund, the home of the brick.
 
 Do you have what it takes?


Technical knowledge of software, computers, or networks, ideally from a security perspective
Demonstrable passion for cyber security
A data-driven approach to problem solving and the ability to explain your reasoning
Curiosity. Do you have a growth mindset and take advantage of learning opportunities?
Bravery. Do you take ownership of problems, speak up when you disagree, and commit to the best idea even if it isn’t your own?
Focus. Do you roll up your sleeves and get things done?
Advanced English both written and verbal is a need since we are an internationally gathered team

 Join the global LEGO® team
 What’s in it for you? Here are some of what to expect:
 


Family Care Leave – We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.
Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.
Wellness – We want you to be your best self, so you’ll have access to the Headspace App and lots of wellbeing initiatives and programmes run by local teams where you are based
Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.
Bonus – We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached, you’ll be rewarded through our global bonus scheme.
Your workplace – Our offices will be your primary workplace with flexibility to work from home during your working week. Your People Leader will discuss the principles of our hybrid work model, role eligibility and frequency with you.

 Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.
 
 The LEGO Group is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay regardless of e.g. race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, disability or gender identity.
 
 The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.
 
 Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.
 
 Build your career brick by brick at the LEGO Group.
 
 "Bring your tech talent and people passion into play and become part of a big IT community and get the chance to spar with other specialists that share interest!"
 
 #LI-JB1






Location




Denmark, Billund, South Denmark








 Job ID


     DK14725
   





 Category




Digital Technology








 Language


     EN

job_summary:
Are you calm under pressure?
 Are you analytical and methodical and can you piece together the puzzle of a compromise? Do you know how to distinguish real threats from fake ones? Are you tech-savvy and open to advising customers on how to protect against threats? Do you like to be part of a team that prioritizes having fun together?
 WE ARE LOOKING FOR AN EXPERIENCED CYBER SECURITY ANALYST
 The job:

We want to expand the team with an experienced security analyst to improve security at our customers
You will be part of our Security Analytics Center – a team providing Managed Detection and Response, Incident Response & Threat Hunting services
You will be working with best-of-breed tools – performing threat hunting, triage, and incident response
You will be working actively with MITRE ATT&CK
You will be utilizing SOAR for playbook creation
You will be focusing on incident detection and response – assisting customers who might already have been compromised and need forensic assistance
You will be communicating directly with customers about cyber security topics and offer them your advice
You will be creating and delivering technical training & consultancy to customers IT and security staff

What it’s not:

A place to get alert-fatigued – we design our services around tools and the mindset of applied machine learning and automation
A place with a strict tiering of roles, tasks & responsibilities – we believe in diversity in people and tasks
A place where we use passionate security analysts to do operational tasks such as maintaining the software and hardware lifecycle or installation and configuration of firewalls
A place where we constantly monitor and assess your performance and measure KPIs – we believe that people are motivated by feeling meaning in what they do, and by that, high performance is a natural outcome

Qualifications:

Experience in threat hunting, alert triage, and incident response, preferably from a service provider or internal SOC/SAC/C-SIRT/CERT
Experience with SIEM & EDR – if Microsoft then a big plus
You can think out of the box when it comes to working smarter or inventing new solutions
You are a team player, and you find it natural to share your knowledge with your purple team colleagues
Ability to script your way out of a redundant task or speedup investigation is a big plus (Python, Powershell preferably)
Certifications like GCIH, GCFA, GMON, OSCP, SC-200, MS/AZ500 are a big plus

We offer:
 We represent an inspiring work environment, where there is a large degree of freedom and self-governance. We are seriously funny and have a relaxed attitude while working hard to provide the best security to our customers. We also love oxymorons.
 We want to develop and are keen to be at the forefront of technology and security with an always-learning approach, seminars and coffee banter.
 We offer an attractive workplace in a flexible and modern work environment where there is room to grow.
 About us
 VENZO_ cyber security is a business unit of the VENZO_ family.
 We are building an expert team of cyber security professionals ranging from advisory and consultancy to very technical experts.
 We have a constructive mindset and believe that creativity and innovation grow when people feel free and responsible. We are keen on building a culture of collaboration and learning.
 We emphasize that we want security to be valuable for business’, we foster experts and we deliver the right solutions.
 Contact
 Send Application and CV now
 Or Apply on Linked In
 Email | VENZO_ cyber security on LinkedIn

job_summary:
About Improsec: We are Improsec. Our company name is a contraction of what we do – we improve security.
As a fully independent cyber security advisory company we take active responsibility in improving the security level of financial institutions, utility companies, public organizations, IT companies, and other medium to large sized private companies.
We are a dedicated team of 35+ employees, known to be knowledge-intensive, competent and respected in our field. We are characterized by solid technical skills, and an energetic and strong social working environment. Our comitiment to provide the highest quality knowledge, experience, and both strategic and deep technical expertise is what allows us to create a SAFER and BETTER future together with our clients.

About the job: As our new security advisor, you will work independently with companies and organizations at a high professional and technical level.
You will have a high degree of freedom to influence your daily work and projects, and to influence the development of the company.
You will be part of a dynamic team of talented people with great passion for Cyber Security within Red Teaming, Blue Teaming and enterprise infrastructure/application hardening.

 
 Responsibilities: As a security advisor you will have three primary responsibilities: 

Providing a wide variety of clients with high-quality consultancy advice and support.
Work with complex infrastructure hardening Active directory/Azure AD protection.
Advise security and implement defensive security measures or services at our great clients.


When it comes advising, day-to-day duties typically include: 

Generating client assessments, feedback, reports and certificates within service level agreement targets.
Working independently with companies and organizations at a high professional and technical level. 
Helping companies implement AD tiering.
Representing Improsec at customer locations.


Skills we can’t do without: 

Full working proficiency in English.
You have a valid driver's license.
You have a solid understanding of the Active Directory Tiering model. Practical experience of implementing it is a bonus.
You have solid understanding of Windows Hardening baselines such as CIS benchmarks and Microsoft baselines.

 
Skills we’d like: 

Full working proficiency in Danish.
You are familiar with Privileged Identity protection and good practice, both on-premise and in-cloud environments.
You are familiar with endpoint device management both on-premise and in-cloud environments. 


  More reasons to join us:
Our culture is strong and unique, and we value a healthy and social work environment – you will work 37 hours/week. You will have a significant personal budget for training, courses, certifications and/or conferences.
You will get to work with enterprise clients on interesting projects together with your awesome technical colleagues and have the opportunity to explore and develop your interests in weekly Nerd Club meetings after hours, or monthly Nerd Days during office hours. We offer good and flexible terms of employment. Salary according to qualifications. You will be working from our office in Copenhagen.

Curious to know more? If you have questions to the position, feel free to contact contact Thomas Wong; (+45) 9310 6032.

Application Send your motivated application with resume and diplomas in .pdf-format to info@improsec.com.
We take in candidates for interviews on a running basis. As we work with cyber security, it is a requirement that you can show, and uphold a clean criminal record.



Bliv en del af Danmarks mest ambitiøse IT-virksomhed
Vi tilbyder en spændende og alsidig arbejdsplads med gode muligheder for både personlig og faglig udvikling. Vi er en organisation i vækst og med høje ambitioner, som beskæftiger flere end 750 medarbejdere fordelt på 7 lokationer i Danmark.
Hos os fungerer alle medarbejdere optimalt i rollen som Hverdagens IT Superhelte. Omdrejningspunktet for vores arbejde er, hvordan vi kan optimere kundernes forretning med IT. Vi er specialister i IT-strategi, -hosting, -sikkerhed, -support og -udvikling.
itm8 IT Relation er en del af itm8, som er en førende dansk leverandør af IT-services til den private og offentlige sektor. Vi er repræsenteret på en række lokationer i Danmark, Sverige, Filippinerne og Tjekkiet.
Koncernen har en stærk markedsposition i Danmark inden for fire forretningsområder; Cloud Services, Digital Solutions, Professional Services og Cyber Security Services. Ligeledes beskæftiger koncernen mere end 1.100 medarbejdere med aktiviteter i 10 individuelle og unikke virksomheder, der alle fokuserer på samarbejde, innovation, udvikling og værdiskabelse på tværs af porteføljen. De 10 virksomheder er IT Relation, Mentor IT, Sotea, Improsec, Miracle42, Emineo, Copenhagen Software, Progressive, Cloud Teams og Me'ning.
Et helt særligt fællesskab

Hos IT Relation har vi stor fokus på at styrke det sociale sammenhold i virksomheden. Vi har en dygtig personaleforening, som hvert år arrangerer diverse firmaarrangementer - både i vores egne lokaler og ude af huset. Det kan være alt lige fra koncerter og sportsarrangementer til temafester og julehygge, hvor medarbejdernes familier også er inviterede.

En sund hverdag

Vi er en virksomhed med fokus på sundhed og trivsel. Hvert år deltager vi blandt andet i diverse motionsarrangementer, som for eksempel DHL-Stafetten.   Vores sundhedspolitik går også igen i den kantineordning, som vi tilbyder ansatte. Vi har tilknyttet vores eget kokketeam, som hver dag laver lækre sunde retter. Herudover tilbyder vi en række øvrige personalegoder, såsom massage, betalt telefon, arbejdstøj samt en gunstig pensionsordning og sundhedsforsikring. 






   Såfremt du har spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte 
   
Thomas Wong

Director of Technical Cyber Risk Advisory
 two@improsec.com
    



Ansøgningsfrist:
 Snarest muligt 
  

Arbejdssted: København S

job_summary:
Cyber Security Process Analyst/Manager Permanent Employment - remote


The individual will contribute to the functional management and documentation of corrective actions and lessons learned findings for cyber security incidents, including Red Team and Table Top exercises.


About Cognizant Cognizant (Nasdaq-100:CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 194 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.

 About the Team / Business Unit Corporate Security at Cognizant is an enterprise wide oversight body responsible for the overall security posture of the organization’s physical (tangible) and data (intangible) assets. The group is responsible for aligning the enterprise wide security requirements to business goals through strategic governance and continuous assurance processes. The governance process encompasses development and implementation of policies, standards, best practices and reference frameworks around Risk Management, Data Loss Prevention and data protection. The continuous assurance functions like security risk assessments and audits, security monitoring, and policy compliance activities facilitates strict adherence to enterprise, client and global regulatory and security requirements.



About You:
 You will work in the Global Cyber Operations team and will be responsible for the following actions:
   

Contribute to the execution of Cyber Security operations, incident response and investigations by documenting and managing opportunities for process improvement and best practices.
Follow up with issue owners to ensure that documented lessons learned are being tracked and remediated.
Perform Cyber Security operations as directed by the Cognizant standard processes and procedures.
Provide evidence of audit compliance for ISO 27001, HITRUST, SOC2 and other Internal Audit requirements.
Provide assistance with metric gathering and reporting of KPI’s related to Cyber Operations.
Ensure proper security controls in accordance with industry standards, regulations, and global frameworks such as NIST.
Leverage the GRC case management solution to document and report on incidents to meet audit, compliance and legal requirements.
Assist the Information Security Officer on Governance, risk and compliance (GRC) management.
Supports team members on risk management requests and provide subject matter expertise.
Review Risk Management Plans against risk appetite, exposure and threats
Develop and document incident response processes, procedures and training program.




Required & nice to have Skills: 
Must Have: 1. Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Electronics, or related field, or equivalent experience 2. 1-5 years of experience with Cyber Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) and/or Project Management with an emphasis on process improvement. 3. Experience with using Windows, Linux, and MacOS and basic internal protocols, including TCP/IP 4. Strong attention to detail by achieving thoroughness and accuracy when accomplishing a task. 5. Excellent written communication skills 6. Strong work ethic with a bias towards action 7. Experience with process documentation



 Nice to Have/ Your chance to grow
 • CRISC, CISM, CISA, CEH CISSP or Security+ certifications
   

Experience with GRC tools such as Archer, MetricStream or ServiceNow
Security analysis and forensic experience a plus.




If you’re comfortable with ambiguity, excited by change, and excel through autonomy, we’d love to hear from you! #becognizant


Contact me: Bernard Pire Director, Global Cyber Operations m. + 32 497 041585 bernard.pire@cognizant.com

The individual will contribute to the functional management and documentation of document holds, eDiscovery and electronically stored information requests

 You will work in the Global Cyber Operations team and will be responsible for the following actions:
   

Meaningfully contribute to the design, implementation, and execution of eDiscovery templates, policies, strategies, and workflows.

Hands on experience managing and administering eDiscovery and document review tools such as OpenText eDiscovery, Axcelerate, Office 365 Security & Compliance Center, Relativity and iCONECT Xera. 4. Strong attention to detail by achieving thoroughness and accuracy when accomplishing a task. 5. Excellent written communication skills. 6. Strong work ethic with a bias towards action. 7. Experience with process documentation.



Nice to Have/ Your chance to grow
 • EnCEP, ACEDS, eDCA, or CEDS certifications.
   

Scripting and automation leveraging PowerShell, Python, or Perl.

job_title: Uniqkey is looking for an SDR to join our office in Herlev.
job_summary:
Uniqkey is an innovative IT company that is in the process of revolutionizing the IT security market. We have been named by Deloitte as Cyber Security Entrepreneurs and on a mission to help companies around the world protect all their SAAS solutions. 

 At Uniqkey, the SDR Team (Sales Development Representative) is responsible for the first customer contact, presenting Uniqkey, and creating new qualified leads for the Account Team. The team has a critical role in our organization, as this is where we create fertile ground for new constructive collaborations and customers. 

 You will be part of a competent team whose task is to create product awareness about Uniqkey for companies in Denmark and abroad. For us, a good and professional impression of Uniqkey and our security solution is essential. 


Your responsibilities at Uniqkey will be to:


create product awareness and sales opportunities
seek out and contact potential customers via phone and email
book qualified sales meetings with decision makers at companies
update Salesforce (CRM) continuously
 As an SDR at Uniqkey, you will become part of our skilled sales team and you will participate in our dynamic growth journey. The sales team enjoys the adrenaline rush of focused work, but also values sharing best practices to ensure team victory. 


Personal qualifications:


you are results-oriented
you are contact-creating and outgoing
you can act as an evangelist for Uniqkey.
you can achieve and exceed your monthly sales target
you are commercially minded and can see opportunities
you can reach the right decision makers to get them to the meeting
you can handle many calls a day and won't be put off by a ‘no’
you are a team player and you can work closely with colleagues, partners, and customers

Professional qualifications:
 You have been working with solution sales within the Web/Software/IT industry, alternatively Telecommunications. You may already have experience in selling SAAS solutions, possibly within antivirus, security, or the like. 

 You have extensive experience with outreach B2B sales and have previously proven that you can build markets and create results. You write and speak fluent English or another European language at a business level. 

 About Uniqkey 

 We are a Danish company, a leader in IT security. Uniqkey's solution for access and identity control brings together the company's SAAS solutions, secures and automatically completes logins for users. In this way, companies are protected against as much as 80% of all successful hacker attacks today. In addition, employees do not have to remember long and complex passwords for the solutions they use. 

 The market is unheard of as SAAS solutions are growing strongly, therefore the need for our solution will only continue to increase. With Uniqkey, you get a Danish-based and serious counterpart to the international solutions, with clear differentiation. 

 We are determined to be the preferred solution for medium and large enterprises worldwide. We have started, but there is still a long way to go, so come and join us, because we believe that we can solve one of the world's major IT security challenges. 


Application: no later than 25/09/20 

 Mark your application with "Uniqkey SDR". We continuously take candidates in for interviews. Start up as soon as possible.

About the job:
 

 The future is digital and Saxo Bank is at the forefront of servicing our clients in a digital way.
   We are looking for a Security Incident Response Analyst for our new Fusion Center. Our Fusion Center is responsible for responding to cyber and financial crime related incidents. This role focuses on cyber and does not require prior experience with working as an analyst in a Security Operations Center but is a plus.
  
 You will play an important role in protecting Saxo Bank’s systems and services as well as our customer’s assets by responding to security events and incidents. You will be part of a team consisting of both new and more experienced colleagues.
  
 The Fusion Center runs 24/7 and working in shifts will be required.
   The Fusion Center team consists of 30+ employees spread across 3 time zones and is anchored in Security & Financial Crime Prevention which has a group wide mandate to help protect all Saxo Bank’s assets and our clients investments.
  
 The position is located in our Headquarters in Copenhagen.
 

 We offer:
 

 Online trading is evolving at a rapid pace. That’s why innovation and development are crucial parts of our culture. We have close to 850 IT employees across the globe who are constantly improving our award-winning trading platform.
  
 At Saxo technology and the business are integrated into the same teams, ensuring end-to-end ownership.We organize ourselves based on what we want to do for our clients rather than on subject matter expertise, to make sure we make a positive impact on our clients.
  
 We encourage new ideas and promote individual ownership of projects and tasks. In that way, every challenge and every achievement in your career belongs to you.
 

 We aspire to be a non-hierarchical, purpose-driven organisation. At Saxo, it is not about entitlement; it is about impact – no matter where you sit in the organisation. A good idea is always taken seriously and you can truly make a difference.
 

 When you work here, you become a Saxonian. Obviously you will get an attractive compensation package. But we also invest in your personal development and offer you large responsibility from day one. We encourage an open feedback culture and a supportive team environment. If you show a collaborative spirit, drive and passion, your learning curve will be steep and your (international) career opportunities with Saxo immense.
 

 At Saxo we don’t just offer a job – we offer an opportunity to invest in your future!
 

 How to apply:
  
 Click the Apply button to create an account and upload your resume (and a short motivation). We look forward to getting to know you better!

job_summary:
In the role as IT Security Consultant, you will be responsible for helping our customers achieve their goals concerning cyber security. We are looking for new colleagues, who understand the fundamental elements of cyber security, and who are able to translate their knowledge to strong technical solutions. You will have the possibility to develop your competencies across our customers and their different locations which covers the entire Northern Europe. 

 Responsibilities 
Assist our customers in planning and executing cyber and information security projects 
Participate in developing Cyber Security Services for our customers. 
Stay up to date on new technologies and learn quickly 
Qualifications 
Have Technical knowledge of Microsoft security and identity technologies, such as Active Directory, Azure Active Directory, Microsoft Defender ATP, Azure ATP, Azure Security Center, and Azure Sentinel. 
Have experience with the MITRE ATT&CK Framework 
As a minimum have 1-3 years of experience with cyber and information security 
Have a relevant background in cyber and information security - education, training, certifications, experience 
Are fluent in both spoken and written English and Danish 
About Fellowmind 

 At Fellowmind we help organizations achieve their strategy with the help of digital tools. Our goal is to minimize the time spent on repeated and manual tasks. With technological solutions we want to create the time and space to have valuable and meaningful working procedures and relations for the benefit of the employee and the organization. 

 As an employee in Fellowmind you will experience that we strive to create a working environment which encourages personal and professional development. We highly prioritize that our colleagues have the opportunity and time to immerse in topics of their interest and influence their own position. Furthermore, most of our work processes are continually being revised and all our teams are eager to acquire knowledge in the form of new skills and areas of expertise. We believe that our colleagues are the best and most capable of contributing with this knowledge, and we therefore all carry the responsibility of developing "best practice". 

 Application 

 Send your resumé and a link to your updated LinkedIn profile to job@fellowmind.dk with the subject "Candidate - Security Consultant (Location)". If you want to know more about the team or the position, you are more than welcome to contact Frederik Stengaard who is the principal architect of the team. He can be reached on his phone +45 3143 9212 


Position: Security Consultant 


When: As soon as possible 


Employment type: Full time 


Location: Copenhagen, Aarhus, Odense, Aalborg, Vejle, Skanderborg, Roskilde or Aars.

About the job: As our new Security Advisor, you will work independently with companies and organizations at a high professional and technical level.
You will have a high degree of freedom to influence your daily work and projects, and to influence the development of the company.
You will be part of a dynamic team of talented people with great passion for Cyber Security within Red Teaming, Blue Teaming, enterprise infrastructure/application hardening and cloud hardening.
Typical projects would be aiding and assisting customers in finding vulnerabilities and misconfigurations in their Azure, Microsoft 365 cloud environment, and Active Directory. This will be done through security assessment and internal penetration tests, with the mindset of an assume breach scenario. Furthermore, you will be a trusted advisor for the customers, which includes recommending the best and most secure solutions for their Microsoft cloud and enterprise infrastructure, whether it be infrastructure designs or security best practices according to industry standards, combined with your own knowledge. 
Signs of success:

You have a deep interest and passion for Cyber Security - especially from the defensive angle
You are passionate about creating the greatest possible value for customers, and you like to be professionally challenged in close sparring with customers and colleagues.
You thrive engaging and working closely with the customers, also on-site
As a type, you are energetic, dynamic, and outgoing. You like to take responsibility and you have a secure sense of quality in your work.
You are constantly seeking and exploring new knowledge in the field and are happy to share your knowledge with your colleagues. You are ambitious and want to be among the best in your field

Skills we can’t do without:

Full working proficiency in English and Danish
You have a valid driver's license and a clean criminal record
You have a solid understanding of the various Microsoft cloud services, including but not limited to: Azure AD, Office 365, Intune, and the security stack such as Microsoft Defender for Office 365 and Microsoft Defender for Endpoint. Practical experience of implementing and daily operation is a plus.
You have a solid understanding of Azure infrastructure and resources, such as but not limited to: Virtual Networks, Network Security Groups, Storage Accounts, Virtual Machines, and SQL Databases. 

Skills we’d like:

Familiarity with the Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework and Enterprise Scale Landing Zones
Knowledge of the CIS Security Benchmarks for Microsoft 365 and Azure
Experience with implementing infrastructure in Azure
Experience with operating and administer Azure and Microsoft 365 services
You are familiar with endpoint management through Microsoft Endpoint Manager (Intune)
You are familiar with the principle of least privilege in Azure AD and in Azure Resource Manager


  More reasons to join us: Our culture is strong and unique, and we value a healthy and social work environment – you will work 37 hours/week. You will have a significant personal budget for training, courses, certifications, and/or conferences.
You will get to work with enterprise clients on interesting projects together with your awesome technical colleagues and have the opportunity to explore and develop your interests in weekly Nerd Club meetings after hours, or monthly Nerd Days during office hours. 

Curious to know more? If you have questions to the position, feel free to contact contact Thomas Wong; (+45) 9310 6032

Application Send your motivated application with resume and diplomas in .pdf-format to info@improsec.com. We take in candidates for interviews on a running basis. As we work with cyber security, it is a requirement that you can show, and uphold a clean criminal record.




CONTACT US

COMPANY: IMPROSEC
LOCATION: KØBENHAVN S 
APPLY BEFORE: AS SOON AS POSSIBLE

job_summary:
Do you want to be part of a company that provides cybersecurity solutions protecting the digital heart of organizations?

Do you want to work in a growing scale up, implement top-of-the-line cyber security solutions where you will have a direct impact and responsibility for how we grow?
If you can say yes to the above, love to work with partners and customers deploying security solutions and want to be a part of a world-class delivery team, then we have just the opportunity for you!
Logpoint is a growing cybersecurity solution scale up building the next-generation Cybersecurity Operation Platform, that leverages state-of-the-art analytics, accelerated by machine learning, to improve cybersecurity and efficiently automate relevant responses to internal and external threats, helping you catch threats before they take root!
We have seen consistent 40% YoY growth over the last 4 years and looking to scale up our operations across the EU and the US, so joining Logpoint will mean joining a growing organization where you'll have direct influence on our growth journey.



Cyber Security Consultant
We are growing our global Delivery Team, so this is an unique opportunity to collaborate, build and manage large deployments and working with the most strategic partners and customers.
As our Cyber Security Consultant, you will collaborate closely with our partners and customers across various domains and sectors to deploy Logpoint solutions. You will bring all your knowledge and intelligence in play as you help our customers to achieve the expected outcome.
Your responsibilities will be to:

Collaborate with customers and partners translating business and security requirements into actionable analytics in the Logpoint solution
 Learn and master the Logpoint solution and assist customers solving their security challenges
 Play an active role in building, sharing and anchoring knowledge in Logpoint, and with partners and customers 
Maintain high customer satisfaction and enable the customers to get the full value of the Logpoint solution
 Relay business 'intel' to colleagues

The position will be based in Copenhagen in a hybrid capacity. As we believe it's important of social interactions with the team and experience the Logpoint culture, you will be expected to spend at least 2-6 days in the office per month with your team figuring out how we can help protect the world!



Personal and professional qualifications
You are a fast learner with a can-do attitude – wanting to be the best Logpoint Consultant, and you are energized by sharing ideas and knowledge with colleagues, partners and customers.
You are knowledgeable about cyber security and want to build your knowledge around Security Analytics exploring the possibilities with SIEM, SOAR and UEBA.
Furthermore, you have:

A Bachelor's Degree, or higher in computer science, engineering or related field
 Experience working in customer facing projects conducting analytics and presenting the findings in a structured and professional manner to the customers
 Ability to work independently and proactively contribute to a global team
 Understanding of Linux, Network, SIEM and Security Analytics and Response 
Updated knowledge and interest in industry trends and emerging threats
 Professional-level in English

A European work-permit is required 
Sounds like a challenge for you? Then don't hesitate to reach out! 


Working at LogPoint
We offer a challenging and exciting international work environment on the cutting edge of cybersecurity technology. As a part of Logpoint's Customer Success team, reporting to the Head of Professional Services, you will experience a fantastic, collaborative team that supports you as you build your quality career and growth ambitions. We embrace remote working, families, and creativity in any shape and form. We also like to have fun while we work, while striving to deliver outstanding results in a positive, collaborative, and informal atmosphere. 
For more information about working at Logpoint, please visit www.logpoint.com/careers (http://www.logpoint.com/careers). 


About LogPoint

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, with offices across Europe, the USA, and Asia, Logpoint is a multinational, multicultural, inclusive cybersecurity company. Logpoint bolsters organizations in the fight against evolving threats by giving them a single source of truth — an intuitively designed platform with the powerful capabilities needed to ensure their safety. Powered by machine learning and backed by an industry-leading support team, Logpoint's complete cybersecurity operations platform accelerates detection and response, allowing organizations to respond to tomorrow's threats.
Logpoint's core belief lies in creating software that empowers security teams to make confident decisions, feel justified in their choices, and more efficiently protect their organizations. That principle has earned them the trust of Airbus, Boeing, Konica Minolta, and more than 1,000 other corporations, as well as a place in Gartner's Magic Quadrant.
The company's culture prioritizes passion, innovation, team spirit, and client satisfaction. Together, these values fuel Logpoint's success across cybersecurity technologies: from SIEM, UEBA, and SOAR, to SAP security and protection for other business-critical applications.

Er du en smilende IT-problemknuser og motiveres du af ansvar og udfordringer? Brænder du for at finde den optimale løsning til hele kundens IT-livscyklus? Så er du måske vores nye IT Infrastrukturkonsulent.
Vi søger IT Infrastrukturkonsulenter, som skal være med til at styrke vores konsulentteam. Opgaverne spænder bredt og det er derfor vigtigt, at du brænder for god kundehåndtering og formår at finde de rette løsninger, der giver værdi for kunden. Du kommer til at arbejde med forskellige kunder, hvorfor opgaverne varierer i størrelse og typisk omfatter store dele af kundens IT-livscyklus.
I denne stilling er der en høj grad af frihed under ansvar og du er selv med til at planlægge opgaverne sammen med kunden. Som IT Infrastrukturkonsulent fungerer du som teknisk rådgiver for dine kunder. Det betyder, at du inddrages tidligt i opstartsfasen af dine projekter og får derved en stor indflydelse på de tekniske løsninger, du senere skal være med til at implementere. Mere konkret bliver du ansvarlig for en række kunders samlede IT-ydelser.
Du kommer blandt andet til at arbejde med konsulentopgaver inden for IT-infrastruktur herunder migrering, fejlretning, implementering af nye løsninger og løbende tilpasning. Det vil være en kombination af on premise og cloud løsninger samt flytning af service til ”skyen”. Du vil arbejde onsite hos kunderne eller remote fra kontoret, men altid med en tæt kontakt på både kunder og kollegaer.
”Du bliver en del af en god arbejdsplads, hvor der er liv og masser af humor og hvor to dage aldrig er ens. Der er mange spændende opgaver og du vil aldrig stå alene. Dine kollegaer står altid klar til at hjælpe” fortæller Mads Hjøllund Søgaard, en af dine kommende kollegaer.
Er det dig?

Du er en smilende IT-problemknuser, som sikrer en høj kundetilfredshed og har ambitioner om altid at finde den optimale løsning
Du er skarp på det tekniske og er vant til at rådgive eksterne IT-folk
Du motiveres i høj grad af at arbejde selvstændigt og med frihed under ansvar
Du er en person med gennemslagskraft og en naturlig selvsikkerhed
Dit fokus er på løsninger og ikke problemerne, og derfor har du skabt gode resultater i din karriere
Kender du ikke en teknologi i dybden, giver du ikke op, men ser muligheden for at lære
Du holder dig løbende opdateret inden for området
Du er vant til at kommunikere med kunder, og du fremstår seriøs og troværdig, og du leverer, hvad du lover

Du har erfaring som tekniker eller konsulent inden for nogle af følgende teknologier:

Intune/Autopilot
Microsoft 365
Exchange/Exchange Online
Citrix
MultiFactor Authentication
Microsoft infrastruktur
Virtuelle platforme

Desuden forventer vi, at du kan sige ja til de fleste af nedenstående punkter:

Du har erfaring som konsulent eller specialist inden for løsningsdesign og implementering
Du har en god forståelse for din rolle som rådgiver over for kunden, samt dét at du er medspiller på vedligeholdelse af kunden
Du er serviceminded, karismatisk og vindende i din kontakt med kunder, kollegaer og samarbejdspartnere
Du besidder evnen til at kommunikere på alle niveauer og evner at svare ”No Problem” til enhver IT-orienteret udfordring med kunden i centrum
Du evner at planlægge din egen hverdag og trives med en hverdag i et højt tempo
Du har gerne erfaring med infrastruktur baseret på Windows Server, Office 365 og også gerne på Azure platformen

Hvad kan vi tilbyde?

Spændende og udfordrende arbejdsopgaver i en virksomhed hvor der er fart over feltet
Nærværende og kompetent leder i den afdeling du ansættes i
En arbejdsplads, hvor du får stor mulighed for at udvikle dig faglig og personligt
God sparring og samarbejde med dygtige kollegaer
Stor fokus på Work-life-balance
En arbejdsplads hvor der er stor fokus på at styrke det sociale sammenhold
Eget Academy hvor kompetenceudvikling er i højsædet


 Du vil blive tilknyttet den lokation nærmest din bopæl. Afhængigt af opgaverne vil der være mulighed for at arbejde hjemmefra, dette afstemmes med nærmeste lederen.
Ansøgning Vi afholder løbende samtaler og afslutter rekrutteringsprocessen, når den rette kandidat er fundet.
Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, er du velkommen til at kontakte Director of Consulting Services, Mads Cramer Thomsen, på matho@itrelation.dk eller 4070 0190.
Vi glæder os til at modtage din ansøgning.



Bliv en del af Danmarks mest ambitiøse IT-virksomhed
Vi tilbyder en spændende og alsidig arbejdsplads med gode muligheder for både personlig og faglig udvikling. Vi er en organisation i vækst og med høje ambitioner, som beskæftiger flere end 750 medarbejdere fordelt på 7 lokationer i Danmark.
Hos os fungerer alle medarbejdere optimalt i rollen som Hverdagens IT Superhelte. Omdrejningspunktet for vores arbejde er, hvordan vi kan optimere kundernes forretning med IT. Vi er specialister i IT-strategi, -hosting, -sikkerhed, -support og -udvikling.
itm8 IT Relation er en del af itm8, som er en førende dansk leverandør af IT-services til den private og offentlige sektor. Vi er repræsenteret på en række lokationer i Danmark, Sverige, Filippinerne og Tjekkiet.
Koncernen har en stærk markedsposition i Danmark inden for fire forretningsområder; Cloud Services, Digital Solutions, Professional Services og Cyber Security Services. Ligeledes beskæftiger koncernen mere end 1.100 medarbejdere med aktiviteter i 10 individuelle og unikke virksomheder, der alle fokuserer på samarbejde, innovation, udvikling og værdiskabelse på tværs af porteføljen. De 10 virksomheder er IT Relation, Mentor IT, Sotea, Improsec, Miracle42, Emineo, Copenhagen Software, Progressive, Cloud Teams og Me'ning.
Et helt særligt fællesskab

Hos IT Relation har vi stor fokus på at styrke det sociale sammenhold i virksomheden. Vi har en dygtig personaleforening, som hvert år arrangerer diverse firmaarrangementer - både i vores egne lokaler og ude af huset. Det kan være alt lige fra koncerter og sportsarrangementer til temafester og julehygge, hvor medarbejdernes familier også er inviterede.






   Såfremt du har spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte 
   
Mads Cramer Thomsen

Director Consulting Service

     Tlf.: 40700190

job_summary:
Summary
Business Information Security Officers (BISOs) serve in a client-centric role supporting the Sitel Group and exist to promote client satisfaction as part of the Global Security organization under the Business Information Security Office (BISO). 
Working with global enterprise clients, BISOs collaborate with the IT solutions team, business development and deal desk to ensure comprehensive security design in a pre-sales environment. 
The BISO is a critical resource to the legal team serving as the security subject matter expert on contractual language. 
The BISO partners with Cyber Security Engineering, Cyber Security Operations, and Project Management Office (including Enterprise Change Management (ECM)) to oversee security matters during client implementations and changes. 
The BISO serves as an internal resource to the Operations team to support client security audits, client change requests, and other security related topics pertaining to Sitel’s clients.
The regional role will oversee the security of sensitive information and projects, client or corporate related, and will advise in the security of the company’s infrastructure to meet client requirements.


Primary responsibilities

The Analyst role will work under the direction of the Regional BISO or the BISO Manager to oversee the security of sensitive information and projects, client or corporate related, and will advise in the security of the company’s infrastructure to meet client requirements
Assist in conducting IT security risk assessments, reviews, investigations and risk management services throughout the company
Under supervision of the Manager or Director, Regional BISO, provide security risk evaluation, audits, mitigation and solutions to projects and initiatives advocating security measures in line with contractual obligations and internal security policies
Assist in the development and implementation of strategies to balance security recommendation with business needs
Respond to inquiries and requests on security related questions from solutions providers, developers, engineers, and leadership team
Work with IT to ensure assets are adequately secured to clients’ requirements
Conduct and support physical security planning, reviews, audits and operations
Provide Tier 2 support to our internal security, operations and other staff in the identification, investigation and mitigation of fraudulent and other prohibited activities, geolocation violations, DLP alerts
Provide support to operations and account teams to remediate missed SLAs for security awareness, termination of accounts
Provide security input to Enterprise Change Management team to facilitate client requested changes
Provide support to the regional team to gather audit evidence and provide follow-up responses to client security audit activities or internal security audit activities
Respond to and work security tickets as assigned to the regional BISO team
Perform case management and execution of support for security investigations under the direction of the Regional BISO or the BISO Manager
Participation and engagement in Sitel Regional Security initiatives, including but not limited to Site Security Questionnaire (SSQ) support, reviewing geolocation violations and data loss prevention (DLP) violations, ensuring that recommendations are made to meet the needs of Sitel clients and the business


 
Knowledge, Abilities, Skills and Competences
The BISO must respond and collaborate with internal partners and clients in a timely manner across international time zones. In addition to English, there is strong preference for a candidate that can bring language capabilities of the region he or she would support. Candidates must have backgrounds in network and/or server planning and design, implementation, and operations, with additional focus on one of more areas of security design. The BISO will apply business and technology skills with structured methodologies to deliver solutions to the customer, conduct solution demonstrations and technical presentations.


Knowledge/Abilities

Knowledge and experience in Information Security best practices (technical knowledge and demonstrated technical expertise)
Working knowledge of Common Security Frameworks (ISO 27000 series, SSAE 18, NIST SP 800 series, etc)
Working knowledge of Privacy Frameworks (GDPR, HIPAA, PIPEDA, etc)
Working knowledge of Payment Card Industry (PCI) framework and controls
Other industry and country security requirements as required to support clients in the region supported
Ability to appropriately handle critical information and sensitive information
Effectively use Microsoft Office products, including Visio, in communication delivery
Effective organization and communications skills


 
Independent Decision Making Skills

Self-motivated, directed and well-organized capable of working in a complex security environment with multiple local and international security requirements 
Ability to contribute security and apply security principles into the design of client IT solutions
Review and contribute security expertise to client requested changes in the Enterprise Change Management process
Input into enterprise security design based on client changes or requirements
Input into other areas of security as client requirements evolve

Er du vild med at lede projekter og få grupper af individer til at arbejde sammen imod et fælles mål? Brænder du for at skabe innovative infrastrukturløsninger og har du den rette erfaring, som kan understøtte en dynamisk virksomhed i rivende udvikling? Så kunne du måske blive vores næste projektleder!  Hos Progressive har vi travlt og byder mange nye kunder velkommen. Vi har derfor brug for en Projektleder med teknisk indsigt, som kan agere vigtig rådgivningspartner, både internt og overfor vores kunder, i forhold til at få identificeret og præsenteret den rigtige løsning ift. kundens infrastruktur, transitionsprojekt og drifts setup. Er det dig, der bliver Progressives nye projektleder, kan du glæde dig til at blive en del af en dynamisk, ambitiøs og flad organisation, der lægger vægt på høj faglighed, engagement og kvalitet hele vejen rundt.  Hvad skal du lave? For at understøtte vores spændende vækstrejse har vi brug for dig, som kan lede design, arkitektur og implementering af løsninger til Progressives kunder indenfor infrastruktur og application management. Din fornemste opgave vil være at motivere, støtte og udfordre dit projektteam og gennem din projektledelse sikre, at projekter leveres som forventet med hensyn til kvalitet, tid og økonomi. Du vil i mange situationer være Progressives ansigt imod vores kunder og det at kommunikere hjemmevant på alle niveauer i en virksomhed vil også være en del af jobbet. Med reference til vores Head of PMO vil du arbejde tæt sammen med konsulenterne og det øvrige PMO-team og have mulighed for at sparre med vores CTO og mange tekniske eksperter. Din hverdag vil foregå sammen med kollegaerne på kontoret i Herlev og typisk indeholde følgende opgaver:

Statusmøder med projektteam(s)
Opfølgning på tidsregistreringer, økonomi og leverancerne i dine projekter
Klargøring af faktureringsgrundlag
Statusmøder med kunder
Interessenthåndtering – eksternt og internt


 Du vil også bidrage i presales- og tilbudsfasen, således at du er med til at lægge fundamentet for et succesfuldt projekt. Derudover kan du også lede større interne projekter så som datacenteromlægning Stillingen vil stille store krav til dine evner indenfor både det tekniske og projektledelse, og samtidig vil du få rig mulighed for at udvikle dig indenfor ledelse af projekter og for at modtage certificeringer og/eller efteruddannelse.   Hvem er du? Vi drømmer om at få en kollega, som: 

Har erfaring med at lede større projekter i en konsulentvirksomhed, gerne IT-Infrastruktur
Har et godt kendskab til Microsoft server og serverteknologier
Kan omsætte forretningsmæssige behov til teknologiske løsninger
Arbejder selvstændigt og kan jonglere mellem flere opgaver og interessenter
Har relevant erfaring og uddannelse indenfor IT
Er bekendt med processerne og rollerne i en drifts- og support organisation (og gerne ITIL certificeret)
Er flydende på dansk og engelsk – både skrift og tale


 Derudover er det et stort plus hvis du:

Agere proaktivt og er stærk i kommunikation med både interne og eksterne interessenter
Har kendskab til Azure, Exchange, Active Directory, Terminalserver (RDS/Citrix) og/eller SQL
Er en glad, humoristisk og hjælpsom kollega
Har god forretningsforståelse og evnen til at løse komplekse problemstillinger
Kan identificere dig med vores værdier (se vores hjemmeside)


  Hvad laver vi her hos Progressive?  Progressive leverer innovative, sikre og stabile infrastruktur- og driftsløsninger, der understøtter kundernes forretningskritiske IT-systemer. Vi er mange kunders primære IT-partner med særlig fokus på services indenfor Cloud, O365, Servicedesk, Sikkerhed, Applikation management og netværk. Vores solide IT-kompetencer, gennemprøvede servicekoncepter, effektive processer samt domæneviden gør os til en stærk spiller på markedet. Vi har blandt andet positioneret os stærkt gennem vores gode, personlige relationer til kunderne vores høje kvalitetsniveau.   Progressive – her vækster vi og har det sjovt samtidigt!  Hos os kan du forvente en travl, udfordrende og fleksibel arbejdsdag sammen med lidt over 100 kollegaer, de fleste på hovedkontoret i Herlev og cirka 20 i Aarhus. Vi oplever stor vækst og der er derfor rig mulighed for at udvikle dine kompetencer gennem arbejdet på mange spændende projekter. Når vi ikke løber stærkt for kunderne og hinanden, tager vi et spil bordfodbold, trækker i sportstøjet (der er mange sjove sportsgrene repræsenteret herinde!) eller nyder kantinens skønne mad. Vi foretager ugentlig en ”puls-måling” for kontinuerligt at sikre en god stemning og glade kollegaer og vi arbejder aktivt med vores værdier. Hver dag gør vi alle vores til, at kollegaer og kunder trives og det er derfor vigtigt, at du også har lyst til at være en aktiv medspiller.  Skal du med på holdet? Så tøv ikke med at sende os dit CV med en kort motivation for jobbet samt evt. relevante bilag via vores karriereportal. Vi vil rigtig gerne have vores nye kollega med ombord så snart som muligt og indkalder løbende til samtale. Vi fjerner stillingsopslaget, når den rette kandidat er fundet og opfordrer derfor til at søge stillingen hurtigst muligt.  Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig. 



Bliv en del af Danmarks mest ambitiøse IT-virksomhed
Vi tilbyder en spændende og alsidig arbejdsplads med gode muligheder for både personlig og faglig udvikling. Vi er en organisation i vækst og med høje ambitioner, som beskæftiger flere end 750 medarbejdere fordelt på 7 lokationer i Danmark.
Hos os fungerer alle medarbejdere optimalt i rollen som Hverdagens IT Superhelte. Omdrejningspunktet for vores arbejde er, hvordan vi kan optimere kundernes forretning med IT. Vi er specialister i IT-strategi, -hosting, -sikkerhed, -support og -udvikling.
itm8 IT Relation er en del af itm8, som er en førende dansk leverandør af IT-services til den private og offentlige sektor. Vi er repræsenteret på en række lokationer i Danmark, Sverige, Filippinerne og Tjekkiet.
Koncernen har en stærk markedsposition i Danmark inden for fire forretningsområder; Cloud Services, Digital Solutions, Professional Services og Cyber Security Services. Ligeledes beskæftiger koncernen mere end 1.100 medarbejdere med aktiviteter i 10 individuelle og unikke virksomheder, der alle fokuserer på samarbejde, innovation, udvikling og værdiskabelse på tværs af porteføljen. De 10 virksomheder er IT Relation, Mentor IT, Sotea, Improsec, Miracle42, Emineo, Copenhagen Software, Progressive, Cloud Teams og Me'ning.
Et helt særligt fællesskab

Hos IT Relation har vi stor fokus på at styrke det sociale sammenhold i virksomheden. Vi har en dygtig personaleforening, som hvert år arrangerer diverse firmaarrangementer - både i vores egne lokaler og ude af huset. Det kan være alt lige fra koncerter og sportsarrangementer til temafester og julehygge, hvor medarbejdernes familier også er inviterede.

En sund hverdag

Vi er en virksomhed med fokus på sundhed og trivsel. Hvert år deltager vi blandt andet i diverse motionsarrangementer, som for eksempel DHL-Stafetten.   Vores sundhedspolitik går også igen i den kantineordning, som vi tilbyder ansatte. Vi har tilknyttet vores eget kokketeam, som hver dag laver lækre sunde retter. Herudover tilbyder vi en række øvrige personalegoder, såsom massage, betalt telefon, arbejdstøj samt en gunstig pensionsordning og sundhedsforsikring. 






   Såfremt du har spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at kontakte 
   
Per Sonne-Dalsøe

job_title: Security Advisor – Governance and Risk Management
job_summary:
VENZO_ cyber security is looking for a new member to join our team of Governance & Risk management experts.
 Do you understand how to advice and guide clients through the fog of cyber security threats, tools, and legislation requirements?
 Do you enjoy taking security strategy and making it work for the business?
 Are you passionate about making a real difference? Do you want to do advisory based on risk analysis and business understanding to improve the security posture for customers – not only on paper, but also IRL.
 WE ARE LOOKING FOR AN EXPERIENCED SECURITY ADVISOR WITHIN GOVERNANCE AND RISK MANAGEMENT
 Apply Now | Our Security Advisory | VCS on LinkedIn
 What is the job?

You will be part of building services around Governance & Risk management in information and cyber security, including assessing potential partners for us to go to market with
You will be working closely with customers – assessing their information and cyber security needs
You will carry out assessment workshops, GAP analysis, Risk workshops and help the customers build their cyber security business case, Strategies and Road maps
You will be our customers trusted advisor within the information and cyber security arena
You can present and articulate benefits, requirements, and solutions for their future state
You are expected to have good consulting skills in the management of stakeholders, scoping of work, information and cyber security and engaging with multiple parties (including vendors)
You understand the information and cyber security risks related to complex environments & systems
You can communicate these risks to technical and non-technical stakeholders

Qualifications

You have ideally 3-4 years of experience working in an advisory/consultancy capacity
Experience delivering security services or cyber security projects.
Experience in development of cyber security services, strategies, road maps and high-level designs.
You know your way around ISO27001, ISAE3402 and/or the CIS controls – and preferably experience assessing and implementing them
Relevant certifications CISM, CISSP, CCSP, etc. is seen as an advantage.
Basic knowledge of infrastructure, AD, Azure, IGA, PAM and SOC is seen as an advantage.
You have great collaboration, communication and presentation skills and you can communicate clearly in Danish and English both orally and in writing.

We offer
 We represent a playful environment, where there is a large degree of freedom and self-governance. We are seriously funny and have a relaxed attitude while working hard to provide the best security to our customers. We also love oxymorons.
 We want to develop and are keen to be on the forefront of technology and security with an always learning approach.
 We offer an attractive workplace in a flexible and modern working environment where there is room to grow.
 About us
 VENZO_ cyber security is a business unit of the VENZO_ family.
 We are building an expert team of cyber security professionals ranging from advisory and consultancy to very technical experts.
 We have a constructive mindset and believe that creativity and innovation grow when people feel free and responsible. We are keen on building a culture of collaboration and learning.
 We emphasize that we want security to be valuable for business’, we foster experts and we deliver the right solutions.
 If you think the above sounds great, then please apply by mailing us your Application and CV.
 Contact
 cybersecurity@venzo.com

job_summary:
About Improsec: We are Improsec. Our company name is a contraction of what we do – we improve security.
As a fully independent cyber security advisory company we take active responsibility in improving the security level of financial institutions, utility companies, public organizations, IT companies, and other medium to large sized private companies.
We are a dedicated team of 35+ employees, known to be knowledge-intensive, competent and respected in our field. We are characterized by solid technical skills, and an energetic and strong social working environment. Our comitiment to provide the highest quality knowledge, experience, and both strategic and deep technical expertise is what allows us to create a SAFER and BETTER future together with our clients.

About the job: As our new security advisor, you will work independently with companies and organizations at a high professional and technical level.
You will have a high degree of freedom to influence your daily work and projects, and to influence the development of the company.
You will be part of a dynamic team of talented people with great passion for Cyber Security within Red Teaming, Blue Teaming and enterprise infrastructure/application hardening.

 
 Responsibilities: As a security advisor you will have three primary responsibilities: 

Providing a wide variety of clients with high-quality consultancy advice and support.
Work with complex infrastructure hardening Active directory/Azure AD protection.
Advise security and implement defensive security measures or services at our great clients.


When it comes advising, day-to-day duties typically include: 

Generating client assessments, feedback, reports and certificates within service level agreement targets.
Working independently with companies and organizations at a high professional and technical level. 
Helping companies implement AD tiering.
Representing Improsec at customer locations.


Skills we can’t do without: 

Full working proficiency in English.
You have a valid driver's license.
You have a solid understanding of the Active Directory Tiering model. Practical experience of implementing it is a bonus.
You have solid understanding of Windows Hardening baselines such as CIS benchmarks and Microsoft baselines.

 
Skills we’d like: 

Full working proficiency in Danish.
You are familiar with Privileged Identity protection and good practice, both on-premise and in-cloud environments.
You are familiar with endpoint device management both on-premise and in-cloud environments. 


  More reasons to join us:
Our culture is strong and unique, and we value a healthy and social work environment – you will work 37 hours/week. You will have a significant personal budget for training, courses, certifications and/or conferences.
You will get to work with enterprise clients on interesting projects together with your awesome technical colleagues and have the opportunity to explore and develop your interests in weekly Nerd Club meetings after hours, or monthly Nerd Days during office hours. We offer good and flexible terms of employment. Salary according to qualifications. You will be working from our office in Copenhagen.

Curious to know more? If you have questions to the position, feel free to contact contact Thomas Wong; (+45) 9310 6032.

Application Send your motivated application with resume and diplomas in .pdf-format to info@improsec.com.
We take in candidates for interviews on a running basis. As we work with cyber security, it is a requirement that you can show, and uphold a clean criminal record.



CONTACT US


   Thomas Wong
  

    two@improsec.com

job_summary:
Are you interested in joining the Security Engineering team that is responsible for improving the security posture of the LEGO Group? We are on a journey to help our product teams by providing useful and usable security support.
  Core Responsibilities


Automating security processes using a variety of tools and techniques
Engaging in and improve the vulnerability management process, through all stages of preparation, identification, analysis, communication, and treatment
Supporting product teams in development and operation stages
Improving security assurance, through supporting services like penetration testing and vulnerability disclosure

 Play your part in our team succeeding
 The LEGO Group is looking for a Senior Security Engineer to join our Posture Management team.
  Security Posture Management exists to help the LEGO Group stay cyber resilient. You’ll spend your time helping product teams to reduce defects and improve control effectiveness by providing easy access to expertise, embedded security, and superior vulnerability management processes.
 
 This is a permanent full-time position based in Denmark. Our office is located in Billund, the home of the brick.
 
 Do you have what it takes?


Technical knowledge of software, computers, or networks, ideally from a security perspective
Experience programming in a higher level language (Python preferred)
Demonstrable passion for cyber security
Experience with (ideally security) orchestration and automation
A data-driven approach to problem solving and the ability to explain your reasoning
Experience mentoring others
Curiosity. Do you have a growth mindset and take advantage of learning opportunities?
Bravery. Do you take ownership of problems, speak up when you disagree, and commit to the best idea even if it isn’t your own?
Advanced English both written and verbal is a need since we are an internationally gathered team

 Join the global LEGO® team
 What’s in it for you? Here are some of what to expect:

Bonus – We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached, you’ll be rewarded through our global bonus scheme.
Your workplace – Our offices will be your primary workplace with flexibility to work from home during your working week. Your People Leader will discuss the principles of our hybrid work model, role eligibility and frequency with you.

 Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

 The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.
 
 Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.
 
 Build your career brick by brick at the LEGO Group.

job_summary:
I'm interested 





WithSecure™ protects businesses all over the world from modern threats. We do this through a Co-security approach born from first-hand knowledge that no one can solve every cyber security problem alone. Every single day, our diverse, growing team fights against online extortion, threats to national infrastructure, the unlawful spread of sensitive information, and everything in-between. The best part about working for WithSecure is our people! We are a community of dedicated and passionate professionals that take workplace happiness seriously. If you’re looking for something that’s more than just a job – we’d love to hear from you. 
Key Responsibilities
 Consultant Level

Consultants are responsible for the end-to-end delivery of our core professional services, from scoping to report delivery and post-project communications. 
Consultants are expected to be technically proficient, with the ability to confidently deliver consulting services to clients, as well as with sufficient interpersonal and consultancy skills to offer advice, guidance and maintain effective client relationships. 
Consultants should be comfortable working independently and as part of a team, and leading engagements when required. 
Consultants have clearly demonstrated that they can add real value to our clients when delivering our services. 

Senior Consultant Level
 For the senior consultant level, WithSecure expects that the responsibilities for the consultant level are also fulfilled. 

Additional responsibilities for providing advice and guidance to the rest of the professional services team. 
Focus on this level shifts to creating value beyond the limits of one’s own delivery capacity, for example by enabling others or helping the business to progress or improve. 
Senior consultants will typically oversee larger, often strategic projects, and contribute to other teams or business units (e.g., Sales, Marketing or MDR). 
Senior Consultants often take on management responsibilities. 
The role of a Senior Consultant is to help those teams flourish by guiding their efforts, directing their talents, and expanding their knowledge and skills to deliver strategic and effective solutions for our clients. 
Senior consultants may also begin taking on line management responsibilities. 

What are we looking for?
 At WithSecure we are looking for a number of different profiles to compliment our organization, if you are able to match one or more of these please consider applying. 
Cyber Security Engineer

Performing threat modelling of applications and/or solutions. 
Helping development teams identify security requirements. 
Supporting the breakdown of security requirements to tangible security controls. 
Driving cyber risk assessment to prioritize remediation's. 
Analyze network architecture, tools, and procedures for ways to improve performance. 
Supporting the integration of security activities in development pipelines. 
Experience in OWASP SAMM, OWASP ASVS, OWASP MSVS. 

Information Security Systems Manager

Create and execute strategies to improve the reliability and security of IT projects. 
Define, implement, and maintain corporate security policies and procedures. 
Advise leadership on organization’s cybersecurity status. 
Institute organization-wide training in security awareness, protocols, and procedures. 
Assess and measure an organization cyber maturity against recognized standards 
Assess, test, and select new security products and technologies. 
Experience in ISO27000 series, PCI DSS, NIST, CIS standards 

Cyber/Security Risk Manager

Lead risk assessments at a business and application level 
Support in the development and implementation of risk management frameworks 
Design and implement risk assessments and the supporting processes 
Design and implement KPI measurements for the risk management output 
Support in the presenting of the risk management findings to an array of stakeholders 
Experience in ISO31000, IRAM2, NIST 

What will you get from us?
 WithSecure offer competitive terms and a modern, flexible workplace and a unique professional environment. In a company culture rooted in quality and innovation, you will contribute to improving the security of persons, corporations, public institutions, and society in general around the globe. You will be given a high degree of freedom in seeking out opportunities, assisting in forming our team and driving further development of services for national and global delivery.

Do you want to be the key player in securing companies’ digital future?
 Nixu is a cybersecurity services company on a mission to keep the digital society running. Our passion is to help organizations embrace digitalization securely. Partnering with our clients we provide practical solutions for ensuring business continuity, an easy access to digital services and data protection. We aim to provide the best workplace to our team of about 400 cybersecurity professionals with a hands-on attitude. With Nordic roots – we have offices in Finland, Sweden, Denmark, Netherlands, and Romania, we serve our customers worldwide. Nixu is listed on the Nasdaq Helsinki stock exchange.  We need highly skilled advisory consultants in the area of GRCPA (Governance, Risk, Compliance, Privacy, Awareness).  The extensive digitalization that is taking place means that the amount of information is increasing exponentially at the same time as the handling of information is becoming increasingly complex. Cyber threats and new regulatory requirements place high demands on companies and organizations, which means that the need for specialists in IT and information security is huge.  Nixu is helping to create a safer world and a well-functioning digital society. It is not enough to be a traditional knowledge company. Exchange of experience between individuals and development of competence must be accelerated in order to live up to new requirements and complex challenges in the current and future threat landscape. We have taken this into account, so when you work with us you get to take part in a stimulating and developing environment with exciting customers and challenging assignments. We place great focus on knowledge exchange and learning between colleagues.
 Are you an aspiring Nixuan?
 You are the one we are looking for if you enjoy being independent in the consulting role, appreciate great personal responsibility, if you are driven by optimizing the benefits for the customer and always work for quality and precision. It's good if you thrive in social contexts, are a team player when needed and think it's fun to occasionally travel for work. We appreciate if you have a leadership state of mind and excellent delivery skills. Prior international experience is also much appreciated alongside with understanding cultural differences.  We are a strong team that is growing fast. Our Danish team is still growing, which gives you great opportunities to influence who we are and who we will become. You will work very closely with the whole team, and we have a strong family feeling. We help and support each other if and when needed.  At Nixu we have an ecosystem of security services where advisory is the spearhead. We work to help our customers to handle information security with a well-organized, holistic and systematic approach.  We are part of an international organization with around 400 employees of which 50 are passionate advisory consultants. The assignments are all over northern Europe and covers many types of businesses. Our Danish head office is located in Copenhagen. Naturally, you can also do remote work from wherever you are at the moment.  You will be involved early in the projects and first work with pre-sale. When we approach an assignment, your job is to, with the help of the customer's needs, visions and requirements, use our methodology and your experience to design and describe the best way forward for the customer from both a process and an overall technical perspective. You must understand and be able to convey the big picture as well as the small details. During the project, you must ensure that the assignment meets the requirements and also adapt, improve and simplify where needed.
 What do you get from us?
 You get to work with us in an environment that really cares about its employees. Our offices are central. You can count on good, sustainable and well-thought-out compensation and benefits. You choose your tools yourself from a list of the newest models of computers and phones. You also receive a generous fitness allowance. You get to work in the sharpest security company in northern Europe. The work takes place with interesting customers in many industries, and you work with innovative and fun projects. Nixu also engage in societal development through innovative and societal security related solutions. In short, you have a great opportunity to develop with us and be in the absolute front line in an industry that is becoming more important with each passing day.  We are offering you a position where you would be the “building block” in building our Danish Advisory unit.
 What we hope to see in this role:

Exceptional passion and knowledge about information security advisory and management consulting
Have worked with one or all of the security frameworks such as ISO 2700x, NIST-800 and CERT controls
You have extensive experience of solving complex business problems with a focus on security
You like to meet new and existing customers
You are confident in yourself and have the courage to challenge your colleagues to develop as a team
You need to speak and write excellent Danish, English and perhaps another European language
You understand the market and know its customers

 
 We also appreciate that you:

Want to sit in the driver’s seat, to lead, not to be led
Can see how security issues are related to business issues and explain this to customers
Have a successful professional life as a management consultant
See what benefits the customer and communicate this
Understand the importance of quality for success
Understand concepts such as information classification, risk management, compliance management, change work, business analysis, continuity planning, strategy work from a security perspective.

 If you know that you are right for the role we are looking for, we want you to come to us as soon as possible.
 Apply now!
 We are waiting for your application! Please create your profile in our recruitment system, upload your CV and tell us why you would be a good match with us.  If you have questions about the job or Nixu, you can contact Peter Hellström directly. peter.hellstrom@nixu.com.  Since we are working with security for security-conscious companies and organizations, we will do thorough background checks as part of the recruitment process.  Learn more about our company on www.nixu.com
